title: Project Appointments
description: Project Appointments Project Appointments support UNIDO in the implementation of specific programmes or projects. Individuals holding a project appointment serve in the country of programme/project implementation or at UNIDO Headquarters. Learn More

title: Consultancy Opportunities
description: Consultancy opportunities Consultancy assignments enable you to take on challenging responsibilities and gain experience working in a specialized organization of the United Nations. Such assignments also allow you to gain insight and expose you to solving problems confronting developing economies in the area of industrialization. Learn More

jobs.title: National Consultant - Management of Unwanted Controlled Substances National Consultant - Management of Unwanted Controlled Substances Dhaka, Bangladesh ISA-NOC
National Project Associate National Project Associate Cairo, Egypt ISA-NOA
Investment and Finance Specialist Investment and Finance Specialist Vienna, Austria ISA-P3
Enterprise Automation Expert Enterprise Automation Expert Vienna, Austria ISA-P3
Full-Stack Engineer Full-Stack Engineer Vienna, Austria ISA-P3

title: Temporary Support Positions
description: Temporary Support positions UNIDO recruits qualified candidates for short-term/temporary assignments in the General Service category to assist offices across the Organization with their workload during peak periods. Learn More

title: International Professionals
description: International Professional International Professionals are recruited globally and are expected to serve at different duty stations around the world throughout their career within the Organization. There are a variety of jobs in this category requiring a high degree of education, specialized technical expertise, analytical and communication skills, and management or leadership ability. Learn More

jobs.title: Director, Evaluation and Internal Oversight Director, Evaluation and Internal Oversight Vienna, Austria D1
Senior Legal Officer Senior Legal Officer Vienna, Austria P4
Associate Legal Officer Associate Legal Officer Vienna, Austria P2

title: National Professional Officers
description: National Professional Officers National Professional Officers are recruited at the local level in UNIDO Field or Project Offices around the world. National Professional Officers are expected to bring national experience and knowledge to the work of the Organization in their country. There are a variety of jobs in this category requiring a high degree of education, specialized technical expertise, analytical and communication skills, and management or leadership ability. Learn More

title: General Services
description: General Services There is a wide range of administrative, secretarial, clerical, as well as specialized support jobs in this category. General Service staff are recruited locally so they are either nationals or lawful residents of the country of the duty station. Learn More

jobs.title: Team Assistant Team Assistant Vienna, Austria G4

title: Junior Professional Officer Programme (JPO)
description: Junior Professional Officer Programme (JPO) The JPO programme is sponsored by governments and provides professionals interested in pursuing a career in international development with the opportunity to gain experience in UNIDO’s wide field of competence while bringing fresh talents to the Organization. Learn More

title: Partner Expert Programme (PE)
description: Partner Expert Programme (PE) This programme gives qualified experts sponsored by Member States or partner institutions an opportunity to gain experience working in the UN system. The programme offers challenging projects and assignments across a variety of UNIDO’s activities. Learn More

title: Internship Programme
description: UNIDO Internship Programme Are you ready to make a difference in the world while gaining valuable professional experience? The UNIDO internship programme offers motivated students and recent graduates the opportunity to Contribute to inclusive and sustainable industrial development in a dynamic, multicultural environment. With placements at our Headquarters in Vienna and field offices worldwide, interns gain hands-on exposure to international cooperation, policy, and development work. Join us and take the first step toward a meaningful global career. How to apply? Internship opportunities are regularly published on the UNIDO Careers Portal. To apply, simply explore the current listings and submit your application online for the position that best aligns with your interests and qualifications. You can find details on different internship areas and eligibility requirements for applicants here.
